title: Of Credit
text: In the case of an individual who is a first-time homebuyer of a principal residence in the United States during a taxable year, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this Subtitle for such taxable year an amount equal to 10 percent of the purchase price of the residence.

logical_structure.result: In the case of an individual who is a first-time homebuyer of a principal residence in the United States during a taxable year, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this Subtitle for such taxable year an amount equal to 10 percent of the purchase price of the residence.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(a)Allowance Of Credit—In the case of an individual who is a first-time homebuyer of a principal residence
                  in the United States during a taxable year, there shall be allowed as a credit against
                  the tax imposed by this Subtitle for such taxable year an amount equal to 10 percent
                  of the purchase price of the residence.

title: General
text: Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, the credit allowed under subsection(a)shall not exceed $8,000.

except: as otherwise provided in this paragraph, the credit allowed under subsection(a)shall not exceed $8,000.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 36(b)(1)(A)In General—Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, the credit allowed under subsection(a)shall not exceed $8,000.

title: Individuals Filing Separately
text: In the case of a married individual filing a separate return, subparagraph(A)shall be applied by substituting “$4,000” for “$8,000”.

logical_structure.result: In the case of a married individual filing a separate return, subparagraph(A)shall be applied by substituting “$4,000” for “$8,000”.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 36(b)(1)(B)Married Individuals Filing Separately—In the case of a married individual filing a separate return, subparagraph(A)shall be applied by substituting “$4,000” for “$8,000”.

title: Individuals
text: If two or more individuals who are not married purchase a principal residence, the amount of the credit allowed under subsection(a)shall be allocated among such individuals in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe, except that the total amount of the credits allowed to all such individuals shall not exceed $8,000.
conditions: two or more individuals who are not married purchase a principal residence, the amount of the credit allowed under subsection(a)shall be allocated among such individuals in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe,

if: two or more individuals who are not married purchase a principal residence, the amount of the credit allowed under subsection(a)shall be allocated among such individuals in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe,
except: that the total amount of the credits allowed to all such individuals shall not exceed $8,000.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(b)(1)(C)Other Individuals—If two or more individuals who are not married purchase a principal residence, the
                        amount of the credit allowed under subsection(a)shall be allocated among such individuals in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe,
                        except that the total amount of the credits allowed to all such individuals shall
                        not exceed $8,000.

title: Rule For Long
text: Time Residents Of Same Principal Residence—In the case of a taxpayer to whom a credit under subsection(a)is allowed by reason of subsection(c)(6), subparagraphs(A),(B), and((C)shall be applied by substituting “$6,500” for “$8,000” and “$3,250” for “$4,000”.

                        for “$4,000”.

title: General
text: The amount allowable as a credit under subsection(a)(determined without regard to this paragraph) for the taxable year shall be reduced (but not below zero) by the amount which bears the same ratio to the amount which is so allowable as——the excess (if any) of——the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income for such taxable year, over—$125,000 ($225,000 in the case of a joint return), bears to—$20,000.

title: Adjusted Gross Income
text: For purposes of subparagraph(A), the term “modified adjusted gross income” means the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer for the taxable year increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section911,931, or933.

                        section911,931, or933.

title: Based On Purchase Price
text: No credit shall be allowed under subsection(a)for the purchase of any residence if the purchase price of such residence exceeds $800,000.
conditions: the purchase price of such residence exceeds $800,000.

                     $800,000.

title: Limitation
text: No credit shall be allowed under subsection(a)with respect to the purchase of any residence unless the taxpayer has attained age 18 as of the date of such purchase. In the case of any taxpayer who is married (within the meaning of section7703), the taxpayer shall be treated as meeting the age requirement of the preceding sentence if the taxpayer or the taxpayer's spouse meets such age requirement.
conditions: the taxpayer or the taxpayer's spouse meets such age requirement.

the taxpayer has attained age 18 as of the date of such purchase. In the case of any taxpayer who is married (within the meaning of section7703), the taxpayer shall be treated as meeting the age requirement of the preceding sentence

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(b)(4)Age Limitation—No credit shall be allowed under subsection(a)with respect to the purchase of any residence unless the taxpayer has attained age
                     18 as of the date of such purchase. In the case of any taxpayer who is married
                     (within the meaning of section7703), the taxpayer shall be treated as meeting the age requirement of the preceding sentence
                     if the taxpayer or the taxpayer's spouse meets such age requirement.

title: Homebuyer
text: The term “first-time homebuyer” means any individual if such individual (and if married, such individual's spouse) had no present ownership interest in a principal residence during the 3-year period ending on the date of the purchase of the principal residence to which this section applies.

title: General
text: The term “purchase” means any acquisition, but only if——the property is not acquired from a person related to the person acquiring such property (or, if married, such individual's spouse), and—the basis of the property in the hands of the person acquiring such property is not determined——in whole or in part by reference to the adjusted basis of such property in the hands of the person from whom acquired, or—under section1014(a)(relating to property acquired from a decedent).

text: A residence which is constructed by the taxpayer shall be treated as purchased by the taxpayer on the date the taxpayer first occupies such residence.

title: Persons
text: A person shall be treated as related to another person if the relationship between such persons would result in the disallowance of losses under section267or707(b)(but, in applying section267(b)and (c) for purposes of this section, paragraph(4)of section267(c)shall be treated as providing that the family of an individual shall include only his spouse, ancestors, and lineal descendants).

title: For Long
text: Time Residents Of Same Principal Residence—In the case of an individual (and, if married, such individual's spouse) who has owned and used the same residence as such individual's principal residence for any 5-consecutive-year period during the 8-year period ending on the date of the purchase of a subsequent principal residence, such individual shall be treated as a first-time homebuyer for purposes of this section with respect to the purchase of such subsequent residence.

text: No credit under subsection(a)shall be allowed to any taxpayer for any taxable year with respect to the purchase of a residence if——the taxpayer is a nonresident alien,—the taxpayer disposes of such residence (or such residence ceases to be the principal residence of the taxpayer (and, if married, the taxpayer's spouse)) before the close of such taxable year,—a deduction under section151with respect to such taxpayer is allowable to another taxpayer for such taxable year, or—the taxpayer fails to attach to the return of tax for such taxable year a properly executed copy of the settlement statement used to complete such purchase.
conditions: ——the taxpayer is a nonresident alien,—the taxpayer disposes of such residence (or such residence ceases to be the principal residence of the taxpayer (and,

logical_structure.result: No credit under subsection(a)shall be allowed to any taxpayer for any taxable year with respect to the purchase of a residence

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(d)Exceptions—No credit under subsection(a)shall be allowed to any taxpayer for any taxable year with respect to the purchase
                  of a residence if—I.R.C. § 36(d)(1)—the taxpayer is a nonresident alien,I.R.C. § 36(d)(2)—the taxpayer disposes of such residence
                     (or such residence ceases to be the principal residence of the taxpayer
                     (and, if married, the taxpayer's spouse)) before the close of such taxable year,I.R.C. § 36(d)(3)—a deduction under section151with respect to such taxpayer is allowable to another taxpayer for such taxable year,
                     orI.R.C. § 36(d)(4)—the taxpayer fails to attach to the return of tax for such taxable year a properly
                     executed copy of the settlement statement used to complete such purchase.

title: General
text: Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, if a credit under subsection(a)is allowed to a taxpayer, the tax imposed by this chapter shall be increased by 6 2/3 percent of the amount of such credit for each taxable year in the recapture period.
conditions: a credit under subsection(a)is allowed to a taxpayer, the tax imposed by this chapter shall be increased by 6 2/3 percent of the amount of such credit for each taxable year in the recapture period.

I.R.C. § 36(f)(1)In General—Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, if a credit under subsection(a)is allowed to a taxpayer, the tax imposed by this chapter shall be increased by 6
                     2/3 percent of the amount of such credit for each taxable year in the recapture period.

title: Of Recapture
text: If a taxpayer disposes of the principal residence with respect to which a credit was allowed under subsection(a)(or such residence ceases to be the principal residence of the taxpayer (and, if married, the taxpayer's spouse)) before the end of the recapture period——the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year of such disposition or cessation shall be increased by the excess of the amount of the credit allowed over the amounts of tax imposed by paragraph(1)for preceding taxable years, and—paragraph(1)shall not apply with respect to such credit for such taxable year or any subsequent taxable year.
conditions: a taxpayer disposes of the principal residence with respect to which a credit was allowed under subsection(a)(or such residence ceases to be the principal residence of the taxpayer (and,

married, the taxpayer's spouse)) before the end of the recapture period——the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year of such disposition or cessation shall be increased by the excess of the amount of the credit allowed over the amounts of tax imposed by paragraph(1)for preceding taxable years, and—paragraph(1)shall not apply with respect to such credit for such taxable year or any subsequent taxable year.

married, the taxpayer's spouse)) before the end of the recapture period——the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year of such disposition or cessation shall be increased by the excess of the amount of the credit allowed over the amounts of tax imposed by paragraph(1)for preceding taxable years, and—paragraph(1)shall not apply with respect to such credit for such taxable year or any subsequent taxable year.

I.R.C. § 36(f)(2)Acceleration Of Recapture—If a taxpayer disposes of the principal residence with respect to which a credit was
                     allowed under subsection(a)(or such residence ceases to be the principal residence of the taxpayer (and, if
                     married, the taxpayer's spouse)) before the end of the recapture period—I.R.C. § 36(f)(2)(A)—the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year of such disposition or cessation
                        shall be increased by the excess of the amount of the credit allowed over the amounts
                        of tax imposed by paragraph(1)for preceding taxable years, andI.R.C. § 36(f)(2)(B)—paragraph(1)shall not apply with respect to such credit for such taxable year or any subsequent
                        taxable year.

title: Based On Gain
text: In the case of the sale of the principal residence to a person who is not related to the taxpayer, the increase in tax determined under paragraph(2)shall not exceed the amount of gain (if any) on such sale. Solely for purposes of the preceding sentence, the adjusted basis of such residence shall be reduced by the amount of the credit allowed under subsection(a)to the extent not previously recaptured under paragraph(1).

title: Conversion
text: Paragraph(2)shall not apply in the case of a residence which is compulsorily or involuntarily converted (within the meaning of section1033(a)) if the taxpayer acquires a new principal residence during the 2-year period beginning on the date of the disposition or cessation referred to in paragraph(2). Paragraph(2)shall apply to such new principal residence during the recapture period in the same manner as if such new principal residence were the converted residence.

I.R.C. § 36(f)(4)(E)(i)In General—In the case of the disposition of a principal residence by an individual (or a cessation
                           referred to in paragraph(2)) after December 31, 2008, in connection with Government orders received by such individual,
                           or such individual's spouse, for qualified official extended duty service—I.R.C. § 36(f)(4)(E)(i)(I)—paragraph(2)and subsection(d)(2)shall not apply to such disposition (or cessation), andI.R.C. § 36(f)(4)(E)(i)(II)—if such residence was acquired before January 1, 2009, paragraph(1)shall not apply to the taxable year in which such disposition (or cessation)
                              occurs or any subsequent taxable year.

title: Official Extended Duty Service
text: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified official extended duty service” means service on qualified official extended duty as—a member of the uniformed services,—a member of the Foreign Service of the United States, or—an employee of the intelligence community.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified official extended duty service” means service on qualified official extended duty as—a member of the uniformed services,—a member of the Foreign Service of the United States, or—an employee of the intelligence community.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(f)(4)(E)(ii)Qualified Official Extended Duty Service—For purposes of this section, the term “qualified official extended duty service”
                           means service on qualified official extended duty asI.R.C. § 36(f)(4)(E)(ii)(I)—a member of the uniformed services,I.R.C. § 36(f)(4)(E)(ii)(II)—a member of the Foreign Service of the United States, orI.R.C. § 36(f)(4)(E)(ii)(III)—an employee of the intelligence community.

requirements: service on qualified official extended duty as—a member of the uniformed services,—a member of the Foreign Service of the United States, or—an employee of the intelligence community.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 36(f)(4)(E)(iii)Definitions—Any term used in this subparagraph which is also used in paragraph(9)of section121(d)shall have the same meaning as when used in such paragraph.

title: Returns
text: In the case of a credit allowed under subsection(a)with respect to a joint return, half of such credit shall be treated as having been allowed to each individual filing such return for purposes of this subsection.

logical_structure.result: In the case of a credit allowed under subsection(a)with respect to a joint return, half of such credit shall be treated as having been allowed to each individual filing such return for purposes of this subsection.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(f)(5)Joint Returns—In the case of a credit allowed under subsection(a)with respect to a joint return, half of such credit shall be treated as having been
                     allowed to each individual filing such return for purposes of this subsection.

title: Requirement
text: If the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year is increased under this subsection, the taxpayer shall, notwithstanding section6012, be required to file a return with respect to the taxes imposed under this subtitle.
conditions: the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year is increased under this subsection, the taxpayer shall, notwithstanding section6012, be required to file a return with respect to the taxes imposed under this subtitle.

if: the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year is increased under this subsection, the taxpayer shall, notwithstanding section6012, be required to file a return with respect to the taxes imposed under this subtitle.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(f)(6)Return Requirement—If the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year is increased under this subsection,
                     the taxpayer shall, notwithstanding section6012, be required to file a return with respect to the taxes imposed under this subtitle.

title: Period
text: For purposes of this subsection, the term ‘recapture period’ means the 15 taxable years beginning with the second taxable year following the taxable year in which the purchase of the principal residence for which a credit is allowed under subsection(a)was made.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of this subsection, the term ‘recapture period’ means the 15 taxable years beginning with the second taxable year following the taxable year in which the purchase of the principal residence for which a credit is allowed under subsection(a)was made.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(f)(7)Recapture Period—For purposes of this subsection, the term ‘recapture period’ means the 15 taxable
                     years beginning with the second taxable year following the taxable year in which the
                     purchase of the principal residence for which a credit is allowed under subsection(a)was made.

title: To Treat Purchase In Prior Year
text: In the case of a purchase of a principal residence after December 31, 2008, a taxpayer may elect to treat such purchase as made on December 31 of the calendar year preceding such purchase for purposes of this section (other than subsections(b)(4),(c),(f)(4)(D), and(h)).

logical_structure.result: In the case of a purchase of a principal residence after December 31, 2008, a taxpayer may elect to treat such purchase as made on December 31 of the calendar year preceding such purchase for purposes of this section (other than subsections(b)(4),(c),(f)(4)(D), and(h)).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(g)Election To Treat Purchase In Prior Year—In the case of a purchase of a principal residence after December 31, 2008, a taxpayer
                  may elect to treat such purchase as made on December 31 of the calendar year preceding
                  such purchase for purposes of this section (other than subsections(b)(4),(c),(f)(4)(D), and(h)).

title: General
text: This section shall only apply to a principal residence purchased by the taxpayer on or after April 9, 2008, and before May 1, 2010.

logical_structure.result: This section shall only apply to a principal residence purchased by the taxpayer on or after April 9, 2008, and before May 1, 2010.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(h)(1)In General—This section shall only apply to a principal residence purchased by the taxpayer on
                     or after April 9, 2008, and before May 1, 2010.

title: In Case Of Binding Contract
text: In the case of any taxpayer who enters into a written binding contract before May 1, 2010, to close on the purchase of a principal residence before July 1, 2010, and who purchases such residence before October 1, 2010 paragraph(1)shall be applied by substituting “October 1, 2010” for “May 1, 2010”.

logical_structure.result: In the case of any taxpayer who enters into a written binding contract before May 1, 2010, to close on the purchase of a principal residence before July 1, 2010, and who purchases such residence before October 1, 2010 paragraph(1)shall be applied by substituting “October 1, 2010” for “May 1, 2010”.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 36(h)(2)Exception In Case Of Binding Contract—In the case of any taxpayer who enters into a written binding contract before May
                     1, 2010, to close on the purchase of a principal residence before July 1, 2010, and
                     who purchases such residence before October 1, 2010 paragraph(1)shall be applied by substituting “October 1, 2010” for “May 1, 2010”.

text: In the case of any individual who serves on qualified official extended duty service (as defined in section121(d)(9)(C)(i)) outside the United States for at least 90 days during the period beginning after December 31, 2008, and ending before May 1, 2010, and, if married, such individual's spouse——paragraphs(1)and(2)shall each be applied by substituting “May 1, 2011” for “May 1, 2010”, and—paragraph(2)shall be applied by substituting “July 1, 2011” for “July 1, 2010”, and for “October 1, 2010”.
